summary: This is an email chain from March 16, 2020, among members of the NYPD/FBI Child Exploitation Human Trafficking Task Force and a federal prosecutor, discussing the postponement of a meeting related to the Epstein case due to the COVID-19 pandemic and planning a status call. It reveals the case was active and involved coordination between law enforcement agencies.

persons.name: Assistant U.S. Attorney Southern District of New York
persons.context: The sender of the main email, proposing to postpone an in-person meeting with an attorney due to office directives and suggesting a conference call to discuss the status of the Epstein case.

events.title: Meeting Postponement and Status Call Planning
events.description: An Assistant U.S. Attorney emails the task force to postpone a meeting scheduled with an attorney due to directives to limit non-critical meetings, likely related to COVID-19. They propose a conference call to discuss the case status and plan next steps like research and reviewing evidence.
personsInvolved: Assistant U.S. Attorney Southern District of New York

keyFacts: The NYPD/FBI Child Exploitation Human Trafficking Task Force was actively working on the Epstein case as of March 2020.
A meeting with an attorney (likely for a witness or suspect) was postponed due to office directives to limit in-person meetings, coinciding with the early COVID-19 pandemic.
The prosecution team planned to use the delay for additional investigative work, including research, memos, 302s (FBI interview reports), and reviewing search warrant results.
The email chain shows coordination between a federal prosecutor and the joint NYPD/FBI task force on the case.
